DataElement.preferredName: RT Structure ROI Volume Interpretation Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: RT ROI Interpreted Type (3006,00A4) shall describe the class of ROI (e.g. CTV, PTV).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: RT Structure Region of Interest Volume
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._The components and their relationship and manner of arrangement in constituting a whole._A specific area of interest defined by a sequence of image overlays or a sequence of contours described as a single point (for a point ROI) or more than one point (representing an open or closed polygon)._The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:The components and their relationship and manner of arrangement in constituting a whole.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
The components and their relationship and manner of arrangement in constituting a whole.

Property.preferredDefinition: A specific area of interest defined by a sequence of image overlays or a sequence of contours described as a single point (for a point ROI) or more than one point (representing an open or closed polygon).:The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

Concepts.definition: A specific area of interest defined by a sequence of image overlays or a sequence of contours described as a single point (for a point ROI) or more than one point (representing and open or closed polygon).
The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/18/19 jk DICOM CDE; Released per qtrly metric review.  10/30/13 created for DICOM RT content. jc

ValueDomain.preferredName: Imaging Region of Interest Interpretation Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: CS: A string of characters with leading or trailing spaces being non-significant consisting of Upper Case, 0-9, SPACE, Underscore. [Standard-based]_A specific area of interest defined by a sequence of image overlays or a sequence of contours described as a single point (for a point ROI) or more than one point (representing and open or closed polygon)._An act or process of elucidation; explication, or explanation of the meaning of the event or thing via the assignment of objects from the domain to the constants of a formal language, truth-values to the proposition symbols, truth-functions to the connectives, other functions to the function symbols, and extensions to the predicates, if any. The assignments are result of human logic application and are not native to the symbols of the formal language. Examples of interpretation include rendering by the psychotherapist the latent or hidden meaning of what the patient says, does, or experiences in understandable to him format; the conception of another's behavior; the establishment of significance of something; the result of EKG tracing reading._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Dose Optimization Reference Object Imaging Region of Interest

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Dose Optimization Reference Object Imaging Region of Interest
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time. : A process that attempts to find the best solution to a problem.: Something referred to; the object of a reference.: A specific area of interest defined by a sequence of image overlays or a sequence of contours described as a single point (for a point ROI) or more than one point (representing an open or closed polygon).

Concepts.definition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
An activity that attempts to find the best solution to a problem.
Something referred to; the object of a reference.

A specific area of interest defined by a sequence of image overlays or a sequence of contours described as a single point (for a point ROI) or more than one point (representing and open or closed polygon).

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Dose Reference Object Imaging Region of Interest

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Dose Reference Object Imaging Region of Interest
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time. : Something referred to; the object of a reference.: A specific area of interest defined by a sequence of image overlays or a sequence of contours described as a single point (for a point ROI) or more than one point (representing an open or closed polygon).

Concepts.definition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
Something referred to; the object of a reference.

A specific area of interest defined by a sequence of image overlays or a sequence of contours described as a single point (for a point ROI) or more than one point (representing and open or closed polygon).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: External patient fixation or immobilization device.

Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface.: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.: Support; approval; moral, psychological, physical, or financial aid or assistance.: Any physical object that is useful for prevention, diagnosis, monitoring, or treatment of disease or other conditions.

Concepts.definition: Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
Moral, psychological, physical, or financial aid or assistance; approval.
Any physical object that is useful for prevention, diagnosis, monitoring, or treatment of disease or other conditions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Brachytherapy channel shield
Brachytherapy source applicator
Brachytherapy accessory device
brachytherapy channel
A natural hollow or sinus within the body.

Concepts.definition: A natural hollow or sinus within the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue.

Concepts.definition: Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Either a point at which there is a maximum or minimum of a radiation dose or the center point of a radiation field where the origin of the coordinate system is (x, y, z) = (0, 0 ,0).

Concepts.definition: Either a point at which there is a maximum or minimum of a radiation dose or the center point of a radiation field where the origin of the coordinate system is (x, y, z) = (0, 0, 0).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Registration ROI
The gross palpable or visible/demonstrable extent and location of malignant growth.

Concepts.definition: The gross palpable or visible/demonstrable extent and location of malignant growth.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The tissue volume that contains a demonstrable gross target volume and/or sub-clinical microscopic malignant disease, which has to be eliminated. This volume must be treated adequately in order to achieve the aim of therapy, cure or palliation.

Concepts.definition: The tissue volume that contains a demonstrable gross target volume and/or sub-clinical microscopic malignant disease, which has to be eliminated. This volume must be treated adequately in order to achieve the aim of therapy, cure or palliation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A geometrical concept defined to select appropriate beam arrangements, taking into consideration the net effect of all possible geometrical variations, in order to ensure that the prescribed dose is actually absorbed in the clinical target volume.

Concepts.definition: A geometrical concept defined to select appropriate beam arrangements, taking into consideration the net effect of all possible geometrical variations, in order to ensure that the prescribed dose is actually absorbed in the clinical target volume.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface.: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.: The outline of a part; the surface configuration.

Concepts.definition: Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
The outline of a part; the surface configuration.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A tissue volume which receives a dose that is considered significant in relation to healthy tissue tolerance.

Concepts.definition: A tissue volume which receives a dose that is considered significant in relation to healthy tissue tolerance.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A volume enclosed by an isodose surface, selected and specified as being appropriate to achieve the purpose of treatment.

Concepts.definition: A volume enclosed by an isodose surface, selected and specified as being appropriate to achieve the purpose of treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An object placed in the field of vision of an imaging system which appears in the image produced, for use as a point of reference or a measure.

A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.: A part of the body that performs a specific function.  For example, the heart is an organ.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition:
Region in which dose is to
be minimized

PermissibleValues.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A tissue-equivalent material placed in contact with the skin to increase the surface dose and/or compensate for missing tissue. A bolus can also be used to compensate for lack of scatter, such as near the extremities or the head during total-body irradiation.

Concepts.definition: A tissue-equivalent material placed in contact with the skin to increase the surface dose and/or compensate for missing tissue. A bolus can also be used to compensate for lack of scatter, such as near the extremities or the head during total-body irradiation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Imaging Region of Interest Interpretation Type

The assignments are result of human logic application and are not native to the symbols of the formal language. Examples of interpretation include rendering by the psychotherapist the latent or hidden meaning of what the patient says, does, or experiences in understandable to him format; the conception of another's behavior; the establishment of significance of something; the result of EKG tracing reading.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: A specific area of interest defined by a sequence of image overlays or a sequence of contours described as a single point (for a point ROI) or more than one point (representing and open or closed polygon).
An act or process of elucidation, explication, or explanation of the meaning of an event or thing.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
